If not, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses. // Help Dialogs HHS Moodle This is the Browser shows you our school Moodle platform. Functionality You can save every website as a bookmark or share it. If you click on the star, your bookmarks will be shown. Just try all the menu entries. Bookmarks Here all your saved bookmarks are shown. If you click on the star the bookmark will be saved as your favorite and will load, when you open the browser. Menus Check the menu (also the toolbar), change the icons. A long click on an entry will also open a menu. Todo list Click on an entry to open it. Click on the exclamation mark and you will get a notification in your statusbar. You can also change the priority of an entry. A long click opens a menu. The list A short click will delete the entry, with a long click you can edit it. Notes Here you can create notes with attachments. Practically You can also receive text from other apps to create a note. A short click on an entry will open the note, a long click will open (as always) a menu. Schedule Here you can edit your schedule. Click on an entry to see all todo entries or notes for a subject. A long click … … opens here also a menu. Settings Login:
If your moodle username or password gets changed, you must change this also in the here. Otherwise the app can not connect you to our Moodle site.

Security:
Here you can set a pin to protect the app against unwanted access. If you forget it, you can delete all personal settings (login, bookmarks, notes, …). You can backup your bookmarks and notes on the sd-card, and restore them later.

All other settings are self explanatory. If you have problems, you can write a mail (\"Contact?\"). Grade calculation Moodle always calculates in percentage (0-100%). Grades are always in condition to this scala. If you set the maximal credits to 100 you can see this scala. Moodle always calculates with the percent scale, not with the grades.

Maximal credits:
Here you can set the maximal credits for a test. The scored credits (middle column) will be set in relation to the maximal reachable credits in percent (left column). In the right column you can see the calculated grade. Create list:
• Create text file: Create one text file per course. In every line you can write a name. The filename should be the course name (e.G..: Course 6a).
• Copy to phone: Copy the text file in the \"HHS_Moodle\" folder on your sd-card.
• Load file: Click on the orange button. In the opening dialog you can choose the copied file. A new list entry will be created. Then you can delete the text file.

If you click on a list entry you can create a note, you can open a menu to edit the list entry. Grant permission Only for Android Marshmallow and above: Grant used permission by opening \"Permissions\" in the next window. After that restart the app. Do not disturb Only for Android Nougat and above: Grant used permission in the next window, to bring your phone in silent mode during lessons.
